body: Why are you reverting the map filename fixes from #12798?  I would prefer that we kept the fixed names and changed any new maps in this PR to match.

In some cases all that had changed were the map filenames. That caused the UID to change and so results in discontinuity with previous releases and with the Resource Center. 
Further, in a comment to the referenced pull request, GraionDilach said "You shouldn't rename map filenames since these are also used for identification on the Resource Center.".

For example,
eastwest3.oramap d07e7ade8051ce0282ea254459189ad02df3f0f6
became
east-vs-west-3.oramap 23d159326d3253b66218b8833b400b2b92ee7da2

Such changes seem pointless to me.

I'm working on fixing the two maps that upset Travis CI. After that, I'll set about reverting the filenames to the playtest-20170304 names (for the common maps) and to change the new maps to match. Please let me know if that's still what you'd like to happen.

The UID is calculated from the *contents* of the map package, so changing the filename does not change the UID:

```
paul@Ragnarok:OpenRA+master$ mono OpenRA.Utility.exe cnc --map-hash mods/cnc/maps/east-vs-west-3.oramap 
23d159326d3253b66218b8833b400b2b92ee7da2
paul@Ragnarok:OpenRA+master$ mv mods/cnc/maps/east-vs-west-3.oramap mods/cnc/maps/eastwest3.oramap 
paul@Ragnarok:OpenRA+master$ mono OpenRA.Utility.exe cnc --map-hash mods/cnc/maps/eastwest3.oramap 
23d159326d3253b66218b8833b400b2b92ee7da2
```
You must have made some other changes to the map (loading and resaving in the map editor would be enough) to change the UID.

Similarly, the resource center doesn't care about filenames.  It assigns each map its own numeric id, which is what you see in the URLs, as well as using UIDs.

> You must have made some other changes to the map *(loading and resaving in the map editor would be enough)* to change the UID.

That's what @dtluna might have done in his PR, though, so reverting to previous file versions might indeed help if that was the case.
Reverting is fine, so long as they are then renamed back to the better name.

Author names on:

16:9 - Your name here
Contra - Norman?
Lost Souls - Norman
Model 200 - Norman?
Model 150 - Norman
Tiberian War - Anonymous
Alpha Juno V - Norman

Norman loves to use all kinds of author names and name styles, iirc the symbol named ones are generally his maps. Should stick with one standard for the pool.

I've endeavoured to ensure that we have the best version for each map. Also, I've cleaned up the file names, map names and author names (including unifying norman!). I'll update the pull request after a third pair of eyes have checked my changes.
I don't understand why @gdavegdave has removed so many maps I've added, and added many choky maps like "Crossing The Divide".

I consider this PR now complete. Please review it and let me know if any changes are required. I have sanitised the map file names, map titles and author names (i.e. given maps by norman a single author name). I include below a list of all the maps along with their UIDs and links to the resource centre. For those maps that were changed slightly (typically map title or author), I uploaded the new version to the Resource Center. As such, the stats for those maps were reset.

For convenience, here are archives of the maps:
[maps.tar.gz](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/870195/maps.tar.gz)
[maps.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/870196/maps.zip)

Quoting @pchote from #12798:
> Please add back Tiberian Garden and *Chokepoint*. I use these for testing the AI, and they're among the most popular shipped maps.

So please let's keep it (I'd prefer to keep it myself, too).

Also, I agree with Sire from the forum and would like to keep Break of Day around for nostalgy/aesthetics/uniqueness/AI+pathfinder testing.

Other than that, I'll trust the community and üëç this once these 2 are back.

Two more minor issues:
* Please squash the fixup commits back into the main ones.
* All maps that include custom rules (like "the hot box") *must* be unpacked.

I still haven't had a chance to look at the maps themselves, but still plan to.

@reaperrr: I gladly added back Chokepoint and Break of Day.

@pchote: I unpacked The Hot Box and I verified that I had removed the custom rules from the other maps (e.g. the observation post from Media Control and the GlobalLightingPaletteEffect from Desert Rats). Further, I squashed the commits into a single commit.

Below is an up to date list of all the maps. Here are the usual map archives:
[maps.tar.gz](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/879825/maps.tar.gz)

Hey guys. See below, what should be the final upload for Order of Battle. I had accidentally deleted a few trees near the spawns which made some tree areas passable when they were not supposed to be. This is fixed here - http://resource.openra.net/maps/20223/
@Irnub I have amended the PR and edited my last post to account for your updated Order of Battle (the map file, the entry in the list and the map archives).
Please restore the map lighting on Desert Rats. That feature of OpenRA's is still heavily underutilized while it adds a lot to a map's atmosphere.

@reaperrr I just noticed your polish of Morbid Aimless Poseidon: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12908

Should I update this PR to include your map, or will you be able to prefer your version in a selective merge?
@gdavegdave I think it would be easier if you updated your PR.

@reaperrr I've updated my PR with the polished Morbid Aimless Poseidon. 

I've updated the UID and link, along with the archives, in the table above to reflect this (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13019#issuecomment-289580017).

These look pretty good overall: a good level of polish overall, what looks like a decent mix of map types, and strong support from the players on the forum.  I'm a bit sad to see you add back many of the old and dated maps that @dtluna removed in his first PR, but i'm also not *too* fussed about their return if you think they are justified (we can always remove them in a future release after the playerbase adjusts).

Here's some comments on specific maps:

When two people quarrel, Fortresses III:
* Obvious tiling errors in the big muddy river crossings.  Can we fix or remove these?

Chill out:
* Ugly tiling errors at the ends of the rivers when the trees are burnt by fire or superweapons.

Crossing the divide, Frostways, Winter's End:
* Boy, the map authors sure like their smudge tiles... IMO these maps would gain a lot more polish by toning these down.

Most norman maps:
* Please change his name to 'Norman'.  Using weird unicode characters make it difficult to filter maps by his name, and hurts readability.
* Many of his maps feature destroyed oil derricks, which I assume were there to be repaired until the custom rule set.  They aren't useful in the default rule set, so may want to be replaced with living ones?
* Why does he put flares next to oil derricks on so many maps?

@dtluna: do you have any other thoughts or comments about this PR?

Wuuu a lot of maps to review.

#### 2 Player:
- **Pirates & Emperors**: The tibtrees need to be moved down by one tile and I think that the two blue tib trees in the "middle" of the map (see image as reference for one of them) are not equal because they don't have the same area to spread, maybe that this can be modified as well.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/24563570/1ad71654-164f-11e7-9a12-957be23946f8.png)
- **Two Ponds**: Same issue as above, tibtrees one tile down
- **The New Mandarins**: Some tiling errors are on the island in the middle of the map (the tiles are from the river set, not sure if this can be fixed or is wanted)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/24564388/fa52dec4-1651-11e7-95ee-a37effeb5419.png)
- **Understanding Power**: A issue is at position 22, 11
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/24564451/3ab5aa78-1652-11e7-94f8-d7386de71dd3.png)

#### 3 & 4 Player:
- **Deset Lakes**: Top and bottom of the map -> smudge tiles
- **Deterring Democracy+**: Tibtrees one tile down
- **Manufacturing Consence**: Tibtrees one tile down 
- **Model 150**: Tile errors at the river ending (I removed the trees for the screenshot)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/24566878/94c61e7c-165b-11e7-8f37-1f06d144002e.png)

#### 8 Player:
- **Pressure**: 40, 43 -> could be replaced with the top-right tile of tile 75
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/24569813/4ce996da-1668-11e7-9edb-aca89457a59d.png)
- **Warchild**: 70, 20 and 69, 93 can be solved by using tile 199
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/24569788/27801eb4-1668-11e7-926c-f3bbc8d2f33e.png)

#### 16 Player:
- **Blood and Sand**: Tile issue at (99, 77), (95, 101), (70, 95) and (145, 149)
- **Morbid Aimless Poseidon**: Tile issue at (144, 40), (13, 42) and (127, 30)
I anticipate that the requested changes (and more) will be complete and uploaded by today or tomorrow.

Thank you to both @pchote and @ltem  for reviewing the map selection and highlighting tile errors, etc. In the last few days, The Echo of Damnation ('Echo'; a major OpenRA map maker) and I have worked through the requested changes. I performed the admin and fixed the minor issues, (moving tib trees down 1 cell and fixing author names). Echo took care of all of the complicated stuff, going way beyond what was requested in the things that he identified and fixed.

Here is a summary of all of the changes:

1. 16-9.oramap - Restored 2 oil derricks and changed map author to 'norman'.
2. alpha-juno-5.oramap - Changed map author to 'norman'.
3. antrax.oramap - Changed map author to 'norman'.
4. arcade.oramap - Changed map author to 'norman'.
5. blood-and-sand.oramap -  Fixed numerous beach and cliff tiling errors throughout and slightly modified SW corner of map.
6. break-of-day.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell.
7. chill-out.oramap - Fixed tile errors at river ends by running the river into two pools and altered the cliffs and trees to achieve this.
8. chokepoint.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell.
9. contra.oramap - Restored 2 oil derricks and changed map author to 'norman'.
10. crossing-the-divide.oramap - Reduced smudge tiles.
11. dead-in-motion.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell.
12. desert-storm-3.oramap - Restored 4 oil derricks (2 accessible only by air) and changed map author to 'norman'.
13. deterring-democracy.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell.
14. deterring-democracy-plus.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell. Fixed cliff issues. Modified NW & NE Beaches to fix squared off edges, glitches and missing pieces. Fixed south island beach on eastern side.
15. east-vs-west-3.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell.
16. fortresses-3.oramap - Replaced by @irnub's tropic-expanse.oramap (a 4 player FFA).
17. frostways.oramap - Reduced smudge tiles.
18. haos-ridges-cnc.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell.
19. hegemony-or-survival.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell.
20. kolosseum.oramap - Changed map author to 'norman'.
21. lost-souls_modded.oramap - Changed map author to 'norman'.
22. manufacturing-consent.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell. Fixed cliff errors, trying to stick to the original shapes, but changed a few.
23. model-150.oramap - Fixed tile errors at river ends by placing rivers leading into pools; changed map author to 'norman'.
24. model-200.oramap - Changed map author to 'norman'.
25. morbid-aimless-poseidon.oramap - Fixed aforementioned tile errors and some other beach and cliff tiles. Found other errors but these are not fixable given the limitations of the tileset and the map construction.
26. pirates-and-emperors.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell and minor eco balancing. Fixed SW river and pond, eastern ponds and NE ponds, as well as some minor cliff glitches.
27. plan-b.oramap - Changed map author to 'norman'.
28. pressure-cnc.oramap - Fixed multiple beach and cliff errors. Removed the river and replaced with a merged cliff. Removed and added trees and debris in some areas.
29. sustain.oramap - Changed map author to 'norman'.
30. the-new-mandarins.oramap - Fixed a few cliff and beach errors.
31. tiberian-war.oramap - Changed map author to 'norman'.
32. tiberium-garden-2.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell. 
33. two-ponds.oramap - Moved tib trees down 1 cell. Fixed river, beach and cliff glitches.
34. understanding-power.oramap - Fixed identified issue, as well as numerous cliff issues and modified the beach pools on the N&S, which also required minor adjacent cliff edits.
35. warchild.oramap - Fixed the beach tiles at the aforementioned locations.
36. warkraft.oramap - Restored 6 oil derricks and changed map author to 'norman'.
37. when-two-people-quarrel.oramap - replaced by @irnub's hattrix.oramap (also a 3 player FFA)
38. winters-end.oramap - the effect achieved by the use of the smudge tiles is felt to be integral to the map.

The limitations of the current tileset meant it was not feasible to fix the tile errors on fortresses-3.oramap and when-two-people-quarrel.oramap without reducing the width of the crossings and thus changing the gameplay, so both maps were replaced.

I think that norman places flares next to some oil derricks for three reasons: (1) they can be used to hide a minigunner to e.g. snipe engis (2) they highlight the derrick's existence when it is reachable only by air (3) aesthetics

Of the maps that dtluna had removed, we had only added back 5 maps, each popular: Dead in Motion (1v1), Two Ponds (1v1), Deterring Democracy + (2v2), Mt. Nukebait (2v2; a unique map), and Hegemony or Survival (4v4).

Below is an up to date summary of all of the maps and here are the usual archives:
[maps.tar.gz](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/895927/maps.tar.gz)
[maps.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/895928/maps.zip)
